chunks.en: First day back at work, what are everyone's feelings right now, and what interesting things happened during the Spring Festival that you'd like to share?
Personally, I feel like the pressure to get married is even more intense this year... Class reunions basically revolve around two topics: work and relationships.
Spacing out on the first day of work, trying to summon the courage to resign.
Went back to Hangzhou a few days ago and it was my first time with my girlfriend, and I actually went soft the first time ğŸ˜‚
The desire to make money has reached its peak again.
Got a red envelope for 8.98 yuan on the first day of work, and the boss made us stand and record a boring video.
Met a very proactive girl on a blind date, feeling hopeful.
My parents have clearly gotten older.

My wife is pregnant, already 8 months along. I spent the Spring Festival with my wife, mother-in-law, and father-in-law at our work-settled place. I upgraded my wife's OnePlus Ace 3 to a Vivo X100s. My wife is very happy and takes beautiful photos every day, this money was well spent. I've been watching dramas and reading novels every day, finished The Grand Lord Is a Black Job and Joy of Life 1, and am currently watching Joy of Life 2. I've gained weight and have more expectations for the future. The baby is about to be born, and I'm going to be a dad.
Marriage pressure, marriage pressure...
Marriage pressure
Marriage pressure +1
A classmate made tens of millions.

Someone in the county who does live streaming has made money. Many of my classmates' classmates have gotten divorced. My parents are getting old and still can't let things go, always comparing themselves to others. There's no solution.
Planning to quit my job at the end of February and take a few months off.
Met a fairy-like girl, will find time to write a post to record it.
Surprisingly, there wasn't as much traffic as I expected on the road today (or even no traffic at all).
Got a new car at the end of last year and it got its first scratch on the second day of Lunar New Year, and another one yesterday, heartbroken...â€¦
@xiaohupro Someone who's been there advises you not to do it no matter what, endure it if you can. This year will only be worse than last year, having a job is pretty good.
Marriage pressure +1. I was born in '97 and have actually broken up with my girlfriend, but I haven't dared to tell my family.
Passed the N1 (Japanese-Language Proficiency Test).

For the first time this year, I didn't want to leave home. Before, going home every year was torture due to family reasons, and I always just wanted to leave as soon as possible. I don't know if it's because my parents are getting older or I'm growing up, but I didn't want to leave when I left on the morning of the sixth day of the Lunar New Year and missed home a bit.
